meanings.definition: The study or description of the suffering or diseases of a particular individual or group.
meanings.sent1: In her pathography, the author detailed the struggles of a cancer patient.
meanings.sent2: The pathography of the community highlighted the impact of the pandemic on its members.
meanings.sent3: The pathography of the cat's adventures with a sneaky mouse was both entertaining and informative.
meanings.sent4: His pathography of the city's decline painted a vivid picture of its challenges.
meanings.sent5: The pathography of the tree's growth through various seasons was a fascinating read.

meanings.definition: A biography that focuses on the illness or medical history of the subject.
meanings.sent1: The pathography of the famous artist delved into her struggles with mental health.
meanings.sent2: Reading the pathography of the scientist gave insight into the impact of his medical conditions on his work.
meanings.sent3: The pathography of the chef's battle with food allergies added a unique twist to his life story.
meanings.sent4: Her pathography of the athlete's injuries revealed the hidden challenges of his career.
meanings.sent5: The pathography of the musician's hearing loss was a poignant reminder of the price of fame.
